row 7 then work 6 more rounds to end with row 6 of chart a the length of the foot measures approx 15 5 cm | 6 inch toe remove all markers with the exception of the bor m change to the 80 cm | 32 inch cable or any cable that is long enough for magic loop set-up round k17 pm k2 pm k17 the next sts will be on n2 k17 pm k2 pm k to bor m now we will start decreasing to shape the toe section whilst keeping our sts evenly distrubuted on n1 and n2 decrease section 1 round 1 k to 2 sts before m *k2tog slip m k2 slip m ssk* k to 2 sts before next m repeat from *-* k to bor m = 4 sts decrease d round 2 k to end work rounds 1-2 a total of 2 times there are 64 sts on the needles decrease section 2 round 3 k to 3 sts before m *k3tog slip m k2 slip m sssk* k to 3 sts before next m repeat from *-* k to bor m = 8 sts decrease d round 4 k to end work rounds 3-4 a total of 4 times there are 32 sts on the needles decrease section 3 round 5 k to 4 sts before m *k4tog slip m k2 slip m ssssk* k to 4 sts before next m repeat from *-* k to bor m = 12 sts decrease d round 6 k to bor m there are 20 sts on the needles final round k2tog twice *remove m k2tog remove m* k2tog four times repeat from *-* k2tog twice remove bor m there are 10 sts on the needles keep the sts divided over the two needles and graft together using kitchener stitch finishing weave in all ends block to desired measurements hook cut a piece of ribbon of 22 5 cm | 10 inch long fold the piece of ribbon in half ws touching if your ribbon has a wrong/right side sew to the inside through 1 side of the ribbed cuff the bottom layer at the center back bow cut a piece of ribbon of 50 cm | 20 inch long make a bow from the ribbon hem the two ends of the ribbon if your ribbon frays sew the bow on top on the rs of the cuff just below the hook embroidery embroider an initial through the top layer of the ribbed cuff using a running stitch or chain stitch and enjoy #snowseasonstockings 6/6
